contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox album | <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = Ultimate Alternative Wavers | Type = [[Album]] | Artist = [[Built to Spill]] | Cover = Ultimate alternative wavers.jpg | Released = May 1, 1993<ref>http://www.builttospill.com/discography/album/ultimate-alternative-wavers</ref> | Genre = [[Indie rock]] | Length = 58:26 | Label = [[C/Z Records]] | Producer = Built to Spill and Todd Dunnigan | Last album = | This album = '''''Ultimate Alternative Wavers''''' <br /> (1993) | Next album = ''[[There's Nothing Wrong with Love]]'' <br /> (1994) }} {{Album ratings |rev1 = [[Allmusic]] |rev1score = {{Rating|3|5}}<ref>[{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r233272|pure_url=yes}} Allmusic review]</ref> }}<!-- Automatically generated by DASHBot--> '''''Ultimate Alternative Wavers''''' was the first full-length album released by [[indie rock]] band [[Built to Spill]]. The line-up consisted of [[Doug Martsch]] on guitar and vocals, [[Brett Netson]] on guitar and bass, and [[Ralf Youtz]] on drums, although there was some variation in instrumentation on a few tracks. The album was recorded at Audio Lab in [[Boise, Idaho]] in the fall of 1992, and released in 1993 on the [[C/Z Records]] label. It eventually went out-of-print, but was re-released in late 2006. The song title "Nowhere Nothin' Fuckup" is the title of a song by the main character, Jason Taverner, in [[Philip K. Dick]]'s ''[[Flow My Tears, the Policeman Said]]''. The song's lyrics, also, are in large part borrowed from [[The Velvet Underground]]'s "Oh! Sweet Nuthin'". The song "Shameful Dread" features a sample of ''[[The Simpsons|Simpsons]]'' character [[Nelson Muntz]] saying his catchphrase, "Ha-ha!" This sound effect is featured in the episode "[[Marge Gets a Job]]". ==Additional musicians== *[[Todd Dunnigan]] - [[keyboard instrument|keyboards]] on "The First Song," "Shameful Dread," "Hazy," and "Built Too Long." *James Dillon - [[piano]] on "Lie for a Lie" *Jake Carpenter - [[violin]] on "Built Too Long, pt. 2" ==Track listing== # "The First Song" (4:02) # "Three Years Ago Today" (3:56) # "Revolution" (4:25) # "Shameful Dread" (8:29) # "Nowhere Nothin' Fuckup" (6:34) # "Get a Life" (5:53) # "Built to Spill" (5:52) # "Lie for a Lie" (3:16) # "Hazy" (6:42) # "Built Too Long Parts 1, 2 & 3" (9:24) {{Built to Spill}} The specific Simpson's Nelson "Haha" featured on "Built Too Long Parts 1, 2 & 3" is from [[Marge_Gets_a_Job#Cultural_references|"Marge gets a job"]]. == References == <references /> [[Category:Built to Spill albums]] [[Category:1993 debut albums]] [[Category:C/Z Records albums]]
